pages.title: Page 1
pages.text: Once upon a time, there was a poor boy named Jack. He lived on a small farm with his mother. They were very poor. All they had was one cow named Daisy. "We have no money left," said Mother. "We must sell Daisy at the market." Jack was sad, but he knew Mother was right.

pages.title: Page 2
pages.text: The next morning, Jack started walking to market. He led Daisy down the road. "Goodbye, Daisy," he said sadly. Halfway to market, Jack met an old man. "Where are you going with that cow?" asked the man. "To market to sell her," said Jack.

pages.title: Page 3
pages.text: The old man smiled. "I will trade you something magic for your cow!" he said. He opened his hand. In it were five colorful beans. "Magic beans!" said the man. "Plant these, and something amazing will happen!" Jack looked at the beans. They sparkled and shone. "OK!" said Jack. "It's a deal!"

pages.title: Page 4
pages.text: Jack traded Daisy for the beans. He ran home, excited. "Mother! Mother! Look what I got!" he said. He showed her the beans. "Beans?!" Mother shouted. "You traded our cow for beans?! How could you be so foolish!" She threw the beans out the window. "Go to bed with no supper!" she said. Poor Jack went to bed hungry and sad.

pages.title: Page 5
pages.text: The next morning, Jack woke up. His room was dark. "That's strange," he said. "It should be bright outside!" He looked out the window. He couldn't believe what he saw!

pages.title: Page 6
pages.text: A GIANT beanstalk had grown overnight! It was so tall, it reached all the way to the clouds! Its leaves blocked the sun! "The beans were magic after all!" said Jack. He ran outside. "I must climb this beanstalk!" he said.

pages.title: Page 7
pages.text: Jack began climbing. Up, up, up he went! He climbed and climbed and climbed. At last, he reached the top! He stepped onto a cloud. "I'm in the sky!" said Jack.

pages.title: Page 8
pages.text: Jack saw a huge castle in the clouds. "Maybe there's food inside!" said Jack. "I am so hungry!" He walked to the giant door. Knock, knock, knock! A giant woman answered. "Please, can I have something to eat?" asked Jack.

pages.title: Page 9
pages.text: "You must go away!" said the woman. "My husband is a giant! If he finds you, he will eat you!" "Please!" said Jack. "I am so hungry!" The woman felt sorry for him. "Come inside, quick!" she said. "I will give you breakfast. But you must hide if my husband comes home!"

pages.title: Page 10
pages.text: The woman gave Jack bread and milk. Jack was eating when‚Äî THUMP! THUMP! THUMP! The castle shook! "My husband is coming!" whispered the woman. "Hide!" Jack jumped inside the oven to hide.

pages.title: Page 11
pages.text: The giant came inside. He was enormous! He sniffed the air. "FEE! FI! FO! FUM! I smell the blood of an Englishman! Be he alive or be he dead, I'll grind his bones to make my bread!" Jack trembled inside the oven!

pages.title: Page 12
pages.text: "There's no one here, dear," said the giant's wife. "You are just smelling your breakfast." The giant sat down to eat. After breakfast, he took out a bag of gold coins. He counted them: "One, two, three, four, five..." Then he fell asleep. SNORE! SNORE! SNORE!

pages.title: Page 13
pages.text: Jack peeked out of the oven. The giant was sleeping! Jack quietly climbed out. He saw the bag of gold coins. "This gold could help Mother and me!" he thought. He grabbed the bag. Then he ran for the door!

pages.title: Page 14
pages.text: Jack ran to the beanstalk. He climbed down as fast as he could! Down, down, down! At last, he reached the ground! "Mother! Mother! Look!" he shouted. He showed her the gold coins. "Where did you get these?" she asked. Jack told her everything.

pages.title: Page 15
pages.text: "The beans were magic!" said Jack. "And there's more up there! I will go back again!" "No, Jack!" said Mother. "It's too dangerous!" But the next day, Jack climbed the beanstalk again. This time, he wanted the golden goose!

pages.title: Page 16
pages.text: Jack reached the castle again. He knocked on the door again. The giant's wife answered. "You!" she said. "You stole my husband's gold!" "Please!" said Jack. "I am so hungry!" Once again, she let him inside. "But if my husband finds you, I can't help you!"

pages.title: Page 17
pages.text: Jack hid inside the oven again. THUMP! THUMP! THUMP! The giant came home! "FEE! FI! FO! FUM! I smell the blood of an Englishman!" "No one is here, dear," said his wife. After eating, the giant took out a golden goose. "Lay!" he commanded. The goose laid a golden egg!

pages.title: Page 18
pages.text: The giant fell asleep again. SNORE! SNORE! SNORE! Jack grabbed the golden goose and ran! But the goose squawked! "SQUAWK! SQUAWK!" The giant woke up! "Stop, thief!" he roared! The giant chased Jack!

pages.title: Page 19
pages.text: Jack ran to the beanstalk! The giant was right behind him! Jack climbed down as fast as he could! The giant started climbing down after him! The beanstalk shook! "Mother!" shouted Jack. "Get the axe!"

pages.title: Page 20
pages.text: Jack jumped to the ground. He grabbed the axe. CHOP! CHOP! CHOP! He chopped the beanstalk! "TIMBER!" shouted Jack. The beanstalk fell! CRASH! The giant fell back into the clouds. Jack and Mother were safe!

pages.title: Page 21
pages.text: Jack and his mother were never poor again. The golden goose laid a golden egg every day! They sold the eggs and became rich. They bought a nice farm. They lived happily ever after.
